topic.title: What if ZeroHello runs out of peers?
topic.body: So I know, that it's nearly impossible, but.. I won't be able to manage my sites? Isn't there local copy or something like that?

1544639635_1Dd32hiiWqzaa3mzA21af2VneXPJd.body:
> [trenta3](#comment_74_14mSHL2TBcqcLNcfpmg5jyGVS9RZia3FiX): Each of the people who have downloaded (accessed) ZeroHello has its own local copy (even you), so it cannot happen, because from now on you will have that exact site in your computer folder. Other peers are only necessary when updating the site in order for the update to propagate, but they do not influence if the site works or the content that are already stored in it.

Yeah, that works if you already downloaded the site. But if you just installed ZeroNet and there is no peers?

> [trenta3](#comment_75_14mSHL2TBcqcLNcfpmg5jyGVS9RZia3FiX): Ah, in that case I think that yes, you won't be able to manage your sites...

Ok, thanks for the answer ;) I think the only solution in that case is start your own [ZeroHello](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroHello).
